8a04cb48-02a7-4760-8b0c-ad137ec028f3.description: Students explore the implications of multiculturalism, diversity and inequality in society and the workplace; construct a professional resume and cover letter; understand the benefits of diversity and multiculturalism; practice good communication and interviewing skills and techniques; utilize Networking and social media to advertise a professional brand; comprehend the impact of discrimination and prejudice; and understand the process of giving and receiving constructive feedback.
8a04cb48-02a7-4760-8b0c-ad137ec028f3.name: BUS 103: Career Development and Interpersonal Relations

5643ad86-50bf-422a-b48f-cecc026be786.name: CIS 203: Computer Network Support

db1e8036-ee2a-4cab-a370-aa015959f0c3.name: BUS 204: Project Management II

139f0cd3-479a-4cd7-9397-ec19db4f1894.name: CIS 303: Scripting Languages

47e81643-42ce-44f0-a71f-10b4b69673ea.name: CIS 103: Database Management

77bb5dc1-a0b4-4de7-9a29-665f9c029df4.name: CIS 350: Cyber Security

ab9e1b45-4953-482d-b4ec-78ac7047cf9d.description: Students investigate public companies and interpret stock information; argue for raising money through stocks vs. bonds and investing in stocks or bonds; explain the benefits of stock ownership; predict the impact of the federal interest rate on unemployment, inflation, other interest rates and secondary market bond prices; research a mutual fund's asset allocation, expense ratio, and portfolio turnover rate to inform investments; and calculate the NVV for a stock, mixed stock, and bond fund.
ab9e1b45-4953-482d-b4ec-78ac7047cf9d.name: FIN 203: Investment Operations

b8b7fdd3-baba-4751-a014-a0b4b7d93ed9.description: The course objective is to develop the skills necessary to be a success and effective customer service provider; explore various customer service situations and develops an attitude of superior customer service; understand fundamentals of customer service, describe ideal characteristics of good customer relations, and apply them to realistic scenarios; and more.
b8b7fdd3-baba-4751-a014-a0b4b7d93ed9.name: BUS 201: Introduction to Customer Service (v.3)

e0bc7e8e-3da8-4283-bb2a-e463c9cd9101.description: Students create a wireframe, mockup, and design document for a webpage; use correct HTML syntactical structure in a text editor; write code that displays multimedia and tables on a website; link an external stylesheet to manipulate attributes of HTML elements; create a webpage, organize content using HTML elements, and manipulate styles using CSS; link the CSS Bootstrap library and utilize the grid system for spacing elements; and host a fully developed webpage with HTML and CSS on GitHub pages.
e0bc7e8e-3da8-4283-bb2a-e463c9cd9101.name: CIS 302: Front-End Web Development

5b33ecef-ce15-4eb5-bd7c-03d50780359d.description: The course engages in a set of hands-on activities, where students will gain a basic understanding of common characteristics and usages of customer relationship management (CRM) systems and their role in the life of sales, customer/tech support and business teams; practice basic tasks done with CRM systems, including entering new data, locating stored data, and navigating basic reports; and practice applying their learning of CRM systems to a commonly used, industry-recognized platform.
5b33ecef-ce15-4eb5-bd7c-03d50780359d.name: BUS 207: Introduction to CRM Systems

ff1b0e51-47d1-495f-ac80-ff59ed139f31.name: CIS 103: Introduction to Databases

b8d148b7-72f2-4524-8ccd-4c566d420155.description: The course objective is to explain the phases of the systems development life cycle and compare the SDLC waterfall model with the spiral model; analyze, devise, and execute tests described by a list of test cases or a traceability matrix using project summaries, requirements, and Functional Specification Documents (FSD); verify software features and bug fixes against a functional specification, both manually and using automated testing tools; and more.
b8d148b7-72f2-4524-8ccd-4c566d420155.name: CIS 301: Software Testing and Quality Assurance (v.3)

4d2da168-1bd5-41b2-a5df-42b263be8d70.description: The course objective is to list and describe networking, hardware ports, protocols, and topologies and identify threats to wireless and cloud networking; define cloud computing and evaluate cloud services and describe practices that enhance network security; know cybersecurity threats and solutions necessary to address the threats; explain preventative measures to reduce likelihood of cyber threats; and more.
4d2da168-1bd5-41b2-a5df-42b263be8d70.name: CIS 350: Cyber Security (v.3)

e9351f7d-07a2-49e6-91ed-0e4a6cc59a4f.name: CIS 303: Scripting Languages (v.3)

40ee0aa5-179d-4be6-8ffe-0212c2e88444.name: BUS 208: Experiential Learning - Professional Sales

90b3397c-5532-4356-8e1e-f4b1c4d47dd7.description: The course objective is to evaluate a personal financial statement and create a personal balance sheet; develop a data set that includes personal expenses and forecasted expenses for future weeks and create a personal monthly budget to track spending versus projections; interpret information from TransUnion and Experian credit reports; decipher information included in a credit card statement; and more.
90b3397c-5532-4356-8e1e-f4b1c4d47dd7.name: FIN 101: Personal Finance (v.3)

d385681e-5d90-43a4-b7eb-ab5d4e220176.description: The course is designed to engage in a set of hands-on activities, where students will gain familiarity with foundational concepts, structures, and tools used to develop Java programs, practice using common processes for peer reviewing, testing, and debugging the source code of a Java program, and gain an understanding of how to identify and analyze similarities in the structure, syntax and semantics of different coding languages.
d385681e-5d90-43a4-b7eb-ab5d4e220176.name: CIS 304: Introduction to Programming (Java)

79a4214a-abff-4746-b10f-5c6c167ff8c9.description: Students identify money laundering red flags; examine due diligence reports for logical and research-supported conclusions and completeness; create risk rating forms for personal and commercial account opening; run an OFAC search to identify persons/entities on a sanction list and create a report of findings; evaluate suspicious activity report (SAR) case studies and identify common themes; and create financial institution scenarios in which a SAR may be submitted.
79a4214a-abff-4746-b10f-5c6c167ff8c9.name: FIN 250: Anti-Money Laundering

5033ade5-b3de-4054-ae61-4f09747d230d.description: The course familiarizes students with foundational concepts, processes, and strategies used to be a successful and proactive part of sales team. Students practice navigating customer engagement situations and building rapport, articulating the value proposition of products, and moving a customer through the sales cycle, gaining an understanding of how market, client and other sales related data is used to identify and quality leads, drive sales activities, and improve sales performance.
5033ade5-b3de-4054-ae61-4f09747d230d.name: BUS 205: Introduction to Sales

The general course topics include introduction to a customer relationship management system; Salesforce; and technology in sales.
7485d5f4-0193-4f49-968b-6ed0abfca61a.name: BUS 207: Sales Technology

a45e73a1-1d99-4db8-ab5a-d8b6fe5b7ca9.description: The course objective is to determine the implications an investment may have on a company's financials and future business ventures; properly document financial transactions on ledger using accounting principles; build a balance sheet and income statement for a sample company; analyze a company's cash flow statement; evaluate company's performance in liquidity, leverage, profitability, and efficiency; and more.
a45e73a1-1d99-4db8-ab5a-d8b6fe5b7ca9.name: FIN 201: Financial Management (v.3)

3dab4451-40bd-4420-8552-185849ff3665.description: The course objective is to investigate a public company and interpret their stock information; argue for why an issuer would decide to raise money through stocks vs. bonds and why an investor would decide to invest in stocks instead of bonds; explain the benefits of being a stockholder and how payment is administered; predict the impact of an increase in the federal funds interest rate on unemployment, inflation, other interest rates and secondary market bond prices; and more.
3dab4451-40bd-4420-8552-185849ff3665.name: FIN 203: Investment Operations (v.3)

927082a0-60c5-49a8-ac23-c3ce08b5dc1d.name: BUS 103: Career Development and Interpersonal Relations (v.3)

171952b3-9fcd-4199-a2c6-6fc0f1e068c4.name: BUS 104: Email Communications Practicum

d34b67be-4620-460c-b63d-f8d8f907ae40.description: The course objective is to consider various scenarios and determine whether or not it is considered a money laundering red flag; take on the role as a report review or analyst and examine a due diligence report for logical and research-supported conclusions and completeness; take on the role of a bank secrecy act officer at an OCC regulated financial institution and a create risk rating forms for a personal and commercial account opening; and more.
d34b67be-4620-460c-b63d-f8d8f907ae40.name: FIN 250: Anti-Money Laundering (v.3)

b4c88b49-2e49-4bd3-ad3d-62a13bd9e7f7.description: Students construct a business strategy for a B2B and B2C company and evaluate the effectiveness of real world business strategies, including recommendations for marketing based on analyzed data; use marketing analytics tool to segment and target customers; conduct and manage marketing experiments in a controlled way; present data visually; produce effective reports summarizing marketing data; and manage a digital marketing project from start to finish using standard PM tools and techniques.
b4c88b49-2e49-4bd3-ad3d-62a13bd9e7f7.name: MKT 201: Marketing Strategy and Analytics

55558998-fcb7-446e-8cb3-e69b986642fc.description: The course objective is to create a multi-channel digital campaign, and evaluate the performance of that campaign; create a social media campaign ad (e.g. Facebook and Twitter) for a given company, and develop a plan to moderate, track, and analyze user-generated content; create compelling emails and run A/B email marketing tests, and evaluate the effectiveness of tests and campaigns; and create a report on a marketing strategy or campaign's effectiveness.
55558998-fcb7-446e-8cb3-e69b986642fc.name: MKT 202: Digital Campaigns
